meanings.definition: The position or role of a custodian.
meanings.sent1: In schools, custodianships involve keeping the premises clean and safe.
meanings.sent2: She was proud to take on custodianships of the library after school.
meanings.sent3: The custodianships of the park included feeding the ducks and picking up litter.
meanings.sent4: His custodianships of the ancient artifacts made him feel like a guardian of history.
meanings.sent5: The custodianships of the keys to the kingdom were entrusted to the most loyal servant.

meanings.definition: The state of being a custodian.
meanings.sent1: The custodianships of the building required attention to detail and responsibility.
meanings.sent2: After retirement, she missed the custodianships she held at the office.
meanings.sent3: His custodianships over the lost items in the office were legendary.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of pride in her custodianships of the family heirlooms.
meanings.sent5: The custodianships of the sacred temple relics were passed down through generations.
